text: HTTP Client Functions The client functions are used to exchange data with an HTTP/HTTPS server. There are specific functions for GET and POST as well as functions for general HTTP requests. Either plain text or encrypted communication can be used and basic authentication is supported. For information about HTTP client functions that are available in APL, see HTTP Client Functions in the APL Reference Guide. HTTP Server Functions You use the server functions to manage requests (UDRs) from the HTTPD_Deprecated collector agent. For information about HTTP server functions that are available in APL, see HTTP Server Functions in the APL Reference Guide. Loading
title: APL Functions - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
